title: Ticket #491: Add new ticket state "Waiting"
description:
Todd,

I think it'd be useful in many cases to be able to put a ticket in a "waiting" state. For example, I've finished the work on the ClassAd benchmarks, and, on that ticket, I'm waiting for results from Will, and, ultimately, and, ultimately, for us to decide whether to go forward or not based on all of this work.

Other examples are waiting on a user to provide feedback, waiting for a problem to occur again, etc.

Thoughts?
remarks:
2009-Jun-10 12:46:34 by tannenba:
Aren't these scenarios handled by the "Stalled" state?

2010-Jul-01 12:03:04 by psilord:
I think they are handled by 'stalled' as well. This is in fact how many of use us that status. So I think you should just use stalled, and I'll reassign this ticket to me and resolve it (out from under Todd, who I don't think will really mind for this specific ticket.).
